question.ask: Questions 1~2  Your neighbour tells you that a new underground railway station is being built near your neighbourhood. Ask her two questions for more details.

std.value: When will the new underground railway station be finished? Where will the new line passed?
std.ai: When will the new underground railway station be finished? Where will the new line passed?

std.value: Where will this new line start? What’s the length of the new line?
std.ai: Where will this new line start? What’s the length of the new line?

std.value: How many stations will the new line have? Which line does this station belong to?
std.ai: How many stations will the new line have? Which line does this station belong to?

question.keywords: when station finished where line passed|when station finished what’s length line|when station finished which line belong to

question.ask: Questions 3~4  You are wondering what optional course to take, so you turn to your teacher and ask him two questions for help.

std.value: Which optional course should I take? Which optional course is better for me?
std.ai: Which optional course should I take? Which optional course is better for me?

std.value: What optional course is suitable for me? Which optional course is better for me?
std.ai: What optional course is suitable for me? Which optional course is better for me?

std.value: Should I take the health and medicine class as my optional class? Which optional course is better for me?
std.ai: Should I take the health and medicine class as my optional class? Which optional course is better for me?

question.keywords: which course should take which course better|what course suitable which course better|should take class optional class which course better
